criteria.name: Effective Summarization
criteria.description: The conclusion effectively summarizes the key points from the entire proposal.

criteria.name: Value Proposition
criteria.description: The conclusion clearly restates the unique value proposition offered by the proposed solution.

criteria.name: Alignment with RFP
criteria.description: The conclusion demonstrates clear alignment with the original RFP requirements and objectives.

criteria.name: Clarity
criteria.description: The conclusion is clearly written and easy to understand without technical jargon or ambiguity.

criteria.name: Memorability
criteria.description: The conclusion creates a memorable final impression that reinforces key selling points.

criteria.name: Coherence with Proposal
criteria.description: The conclusion is coherent with the rest of the proposal, without introducing new information.

criteria.name: Call to Action
criteria.description: The conclusion includes an effective call to action or next steps for the client.

criteria.name: Confidence
criteria.description: The conclusion conveys confidence in the proposal's ability to meet client needs.

criteria.name: Conciseness
criteria.description: The conclusion is appropriately concise while covering all essential elements.

criteria.name: Future Orientation
criteria.description: The conclusion addresses the future relationship or ongoing partnership possibilities.

evaluationInstructions: Evaluate the conclusion against each criterion. For each criterion, provide a score between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely failing to meet the criterion and 1.0 is perfectly meeting it. Provide specific feedback for scores below the pass threshold.
